meanings.definition: To put on a roster or list.
meanings.sent1: The coach rostered the players for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent2: She rostered the tasks for the team members efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The teacher rostered the students for the class play.
meanings.sent4: The manager rostered the projects like a well-organized puzzle.
meanings.sent5: Rostering the duties ensured everyone had a clear role.

meanings.definition: To schedule or assign to a roster.
meanings.sent1: They rostered the shifts for the employees at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: He rostered the meetings for the week ahead.
meanings.sent3: Rostering the chores made the household run smoothly.
meanings.sent4: She rostered the tasks with precision, like a skilled conductor.
meanings.sent5: The captain rostered the players strategically for the game.

meanings.definition: Included on a list or schedule.
meanings.sent1: The rostered employees were ready for their shifts.
meanings.sent2: She was one of the rostered volunteers for the event.
meanings.sent3: The rostered items on the agenda were discussed first.
meanings.sent4: The rostered names stood out on the list.
meanings.sent5: Being rostered for the event brought a sense of responsibility.
